results.title: Western stories: expressions for the future : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description:
Western Stories : Expressions for the Future is an inspirational collection of works from young people who, through their association with the Western Chances program, have been given the opportunity to tell their stories and build their own bridge to the future.
Western Chances was established to ensure that financial hardship does not prevent a young person in Melbourne’s West from achieving their maximum potential in life.

results.title: Western stories : expressions for the future : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: Paul Young, Maria Savarino, Ayen Guinto, Krystal Webb, Marten McEachran, Samantha Sharp, Laura O'Donnell, Chris Villarroel, Dean Sacco, Charles Skoutariotis, Katherine O'Neill, Troy Maguire, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Twelve stories from people from Melbourne’s western suburbs, created at ACMI as part of ‘Western stories : Expressions for the future’ Digital Storytelling project. The participants talk about the things they love and, in doing so, highlight what it is about them that make them unique.

results.title: Western Samoa: the best of both worlds?
results.creator_credit: Henrietta Clark and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: Explores the changes occuring in Western Samoa which give young people the choice between the “modern” world of the capital city, Alpia and traditional village life. Explains how each family member has a particular role to perform within the structured village society.

results.title: Western Germany: the land and the people
results.brief_description: The industrial, agricultural and commercial life of Western Germany is shown in relationship to the dense population, natural resources, and relatively infertile soil of this area. The importance of coal, trade, and synthetic products in the industrial development of this country is shown against the background of its present-day economy.

results.title: Western Europe: an introduction
results.brief_description: An introduction to the basic geographic concepts of eleven countries in west Europe: Britain, Belgium, the Netherlands, Western Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Italy, France, Spain and Portugal. Presents the complexity of various countries and peoples; the dense population, the careful and varied uses of the land in relationship to the climate; the importance of manufacture and trade and also the close link between the history and geography of Europe to the western world.

results.title: Western Australia: the search for oil
results.creator_credit: Norman A. Uren and Western Australian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows the first operational stage of the search for oil at Exmouth Gulf (WA) including the seismograph party making exploratory drillings and echo soundings with explosives. (Explains the principle of this method with diagrams.) A highlight is the building of the large derrick before drilling for oil began.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Norman A. Uren and Western Australian Government Film Unit
results.description: Shows the first operational stage of the search for oil at Exmouth Gulf (WA) including the seismograph party making exploratory drillings and echo soundings with explosives.
